column2: A custom visual calendar for iOS 8+ written in Swift (>= 4.0).

column5: message

Use dynamic colors for iOS 13 to adjust to dark mode (#572)

* Use dynamic colors for dark mode in iOS 13

* Use dynamic color for text

Update to allow for Disabled Scrolling in WeekView (#568)

* Add Variables

* Updated Flags to determine scroll ability

fix division by zero issue on ios 10 (#557)

On iOS 10 scrollview.contentOffset.x - scrollView.frame.width returns zero, so at this point CVCalendar is crashing. With this fix it works on iOS 10 and above as well.

#523

Add delegate method for a week change. (#554)

This duplicates logic implemented in a `CVCalendarMonthContentViewController` but for a `CVCalendarWeeksContentViewController`.
fix: use proper calendar to calculate next month for weekview (#551)
fix: skip duplicates when navigatie between weeks (#552)

fix: remove setup labels for refresh month (#550)

I found a problem in the latest version `1.6.1`. 
When you refreshed current month it adding duplicates for day view labels, it will add as many labels as you many times you refresh month.
Fix toggle day for a week view, in case when any date wasn't selected yet (#549)
Pass calendar to convertedDate when receiving a touch in a day view (#541)

Swift4.2 (#538)

Migration from Swift 4.0 to Swift 4.2. 

Basically everything is being migrated with the xcode syntax conversion tool. 

Also updated the example so it runs and the tests are successful.

Call interactionSetup() when refreshing (#493)

* Call interactionSetup() when refreshing

* Also update the label appearance
Initialize month view with calendar view's presented date, if available, falling back to the current date.

Feature/extend localization (#487)

* Localized string in DayView using calendar locale.

* Add specific calendar and localization support to MenuView

* Custom locale set in demo.

* Calendar method removed from MenuViewDelegate.
Calendar property made optional with default value.

fix issue where 'out' dates still selectable when should be disabled
Notify about date selection during the automatic selection on changing a month;
Set proper day view text color during the initialization for current date;

Fix demo’s drawing of supplementary view. The issue is that dayView.frame.midX is used to determine the path’s center point but the result is relative to the parent and not to the day view’s cell.
The center point should be relative to the day view’s cell so we just want the dayView’s cell mid point (bounds.width/2, bounds.height/2).
Revert commented code

Make sure to construct the calendar before anything uses it.
Make sure to always use the calendar from the delegate instead of the current calendar.

Readme.md edit

Style changes

This PR doesn’t change anything in the code functionality, it just
makes the style more consistent and changes what I described in #262.
Feel free to ignore it if you think some of these changes need further
discussion.

Cleared all warnings and merged CVCalendar and Demo directories

Swift 2.2 warnings were cleared only in the Demo directory, I added
those changes to the CVCalendar directory too.
There was also another warning in CVCalendarViewAnimator about
`dayView` not being used, I cleared that.
There were other differences between the files in the Demo and
CVCalendar directories, I merged them, trying to keep what seemed like
the latest changes to the best of my knowledge.
fixed remaining deprecation in CVSet for swift2.2
